medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at midnight, progressively worsened, and the patient describes it as the worst pain he has ever felt. There was no improvement with positioning or antacids, and he denies any fevers, nausea, or vomiting. He experienced diarrhea the previous evening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hemorrhoids, hypertriglyceridemia, last colonoscopy 6 months ago was normal. Past surgical history includes appendectomy, inguinal hernia repair, and undescended testicle repair.
